Instruction: Collect all the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Add cold water, one tablespoon at a time, mixing until the dough comes together.
Mix in water until the dough comes together into a ball.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare a baking sheet by lightly greasing it or lining it with parchment paper.

To prepare the beef filling: Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Sautï¿½ onion and chopped Scotch bonnet pepper until softened, about 2 minutes. Add ground beef and season with 1 teaspoon of curry powder, allspice, ground cloves, thyme, pepper, and salt. Cook while stirring continuously until the beef is fully browned, taking about 8 to 10 minutes. Crumble in the bouillon cube, then mix in 1/2 cup of water and browning sauce until well incorporated; add the bay leaf and let it simmer until the liquid is absorbed. Remove the skillet from heat, discard the bay leaf, and stir in the bread crumbs.
Scoop equal portions of the filling onto each pastry circle.
Fold over and pinch the edges to create a half-moon shape. Seal the edges with the back of a fork, then brush the tops with beaten egg. Arrange the pastries on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until they turn golden brown, approximately 30 minutes.
